FuncDef: The startup patch all command configures a patch file for the next AP startup.
CLIs: startup patch <packagename> all { { ap-id { <startapid> [ to <endapid> ] } &<1-10> } | all-ap }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a patch file.
The value is a string of 5 to 127 case-sensitive characters without spaces. The value of the patch name is a string of 5 to 63 characters.

Specifies an ID for an AP.
The value is an integer ranging from 1024 to 8191.

Specifies a start AP ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1024 to 8191.

Specifies an end AP ID. An end AP ID cannot be less than a start AP ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1024 to 8192.

Configures a patch file for the next startup of all APs.
-

Examples: Info: Operating, please wait for a moment...done.
Info: Succeeded in setting startup the patch of ap 100.Info: Succeeded in setting startup the patch of ap 101.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure a patch file for the next startup of a specified AP, run the startup patch all ap-id command.
To configure a patch file for the next startup of all APs, run the startup patch all all-ap command.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
